summary: type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) is becoming a crucial threat to human health, with approximately 425 million individuals worldwide in 2017. it is estimated that the number will exhibit a 45% increase in three decades. chronic hyperglycemia causes macrovascular and microvascular complications and remodeling in the heart, kidneys, eyes, and nerves. the pharmaceutical composition of Tangminling pill comprises extracts of the following ten traditional Chinese herbs. it was manufactured and capsulated with specific processing of Chinese herbal medicine in Tasly Pharmaceutical (Tianjin, China) data search and selection Relevant RCTs were identified from the following data sources: Medline, China VIP, China National Knowledge Internet, and Cochrane library. literature searched with the terms (‘Tang-min-ling’ or ‘TM81’ or ‘Tangminling’ or ‘TML’) AND (‘diabetes’ or ‘T2DM’). Publication status, language, and date were not restricted. chi-square P was 0.10 and I2 was >50%. pooled WMDs with 95% CIs were analyzed. sensitivity analyses were performed to evaluate individual effects and explain possible heterogeneity. the chemical composition of Tangminling pill was further analyzed using the high-performance liquid chromatography/mass spectrometry (HPLC/MS) method. the study project conformed to the ethical rules of the Helsinki Declaration (revised edition in October 2013) literature search and data extraction were performed blindly by two authors. heterogeneity was evaluated by the Cochran’s Q statistic and the inconsistency index (I2) sensitivity analyses were performed to evaluate individual effects. the loss to follow-up was 10% in all RCTs. the methodological quality of the retrieved studies was generally high. blood glucose improvement was evaluated by reductions of hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) and fasting plasma glucose (FPG) levels. T2DM is a chronic metabolic disease in which the deterioration of glycemic control is associated with progressive islet -cell dysfunction. our analyses revealed that Tangminling reduced blood glucose mildly, without hypoglycemic events reported. there was a significant disparity in sample sizes among the four RCTs included in our pooled analyses. however, after excluding this study, no substantial alteration was found in pooled WMDs. funding This work was supported by the clinical medicine science and technology innovation plan of Jinan Science and Technology Bureau. the planned science and technology project of Guangdong province was supported by the Beijing Municipal Natural Science Foundation. authors read and approved the manuscript.
